channel.title: Compiler Help
channel.description: okay , so i updated my java to update 26. When i click compile it says, "The system cannot find the path specified." I know i need to edit the compiler to make it work. The compiler says: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\1bin\javac.exe" -d .\bin .\src\*.java I don't know what im doing wrong. Please help :) Thanks

item.title: Compiler Help
item.dc:creator: @Tension_Ltd Tension Ltd
item.description:
@Tension_Ltd wrote:

Thanks, I knew it had something to do witht that , updated my jdk and now it works thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Help
item.dc:creator: @belhelmiel belhelmiel
item.description:
@belhelmiel wrote:

You updated your java or did you update your jdk? Big difference. Go to C:\Program Files\Java\ and see what versions of jdk you have. Good luck with your compiler :3

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Help
item.dc:creator: @Tension_Ltd Tension Ltd
item.description:
@Tension_Ltd wrote:

okay , so i updated my java to update 26.
When i click compile it says, “The system cannot find the path specified.”
I know i need to edit the compiler to make it work.
The compiler says: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\1bin\javac.exe" -d .\bin .\src*.java
I don’t know what im doing wrong. Please help
Thanks

Read full topic
